org.eng.aisp

Class DoubleWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.util.InstanceIdentifiedObject
      • org.eng.aisp.AbstractDataWindow<double[]>
        • org.eng.aisp.DoubleWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IDataWindow<double[]>, IDoubleWindow, IInstanceID
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DoubleFeature, SoundClip

    public class DoubleWindow
extends AbstractDataWindow<double[]>
implements IDoubleWindow
    Implements a data window holding an array of double values.
    Author:
    dawood
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • newSubWindow

        protected DoubleWindow newSubWindow(double newStartMsec,
                                    int startSampleIndex,
                                    int endSampleIndex)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDataWindow
        Used by #subWindow(int, int) to create a new instance of a window that has the new start time and given data using the given logical indexes into the data. The new window is a subwindow of this instance and so should, in general, copy the sampling rate and context from this instance. The new end time can be computed from the new start time, sampling rate and amount of new data.
        Specified by:
        newSubWindow in class AbstractDataWindow<double[]>
        startSampleIndex - first logical index (0-based) of sampled data to include in new window.
        endSampleIndex - last logical index, exclusive, of the sampled data to include in the window.
        Returns:

      • uncachedPad

        protected DoubleWindow uncachedPad(double durationMsec,
                                   IDataWindow.PadType padType)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDataWindow
        Create a new window of the requested length in which the data from this instance are the first samples in the returned window and the remaining samples are padded according to padType.
        Specified by:
        uncachedPad in class AbstractDataWindow<double[]>
        Parameters:
        durationMsec - the length of the returned window. This will always be larger than the instance calling this method.
        Returns:
        null if padding is not supported/needed (for example SoundClipMetaData).

      • pad

        public static double[] pad(double[] data,
                           double samplesPerSecond,
                           double durationMsec,
                           IDataWindow.PadType padType)
        Create a new array that is a copy of the given array and padded with data per padType.
        Parameters:
        data - data to copy and perhaps to use as padding.
        samplesPerSecond - the sampling rate of the given data.
        durationMsec - the duration of the returned data, according to the sampling rate.
        padType -
        Returns:
        a new array of size determined by the duration and sampling rate that is padded according to padType.
